content: frankie s knitted stuff knot bag based on a traditional japanese design this knitted knot bag has one long handle and one short thread the long handle through the short and wear it on your wrist it s ideal for carrying just a few essentials when out and about or you can use it as a small project bag it would make a nice gift bag too the bag is worked in one piece in the round apart from the handles which have to be worked back and forth this means there are only two short seams to sew as the stitch pattern is a dense one there is no need to line the bag although you can add a covered base if you want your bag to have a flat bottom more of that later i knitted two sizes of bag both using dk weight yarn the one pictured above is about 15 cm / 6 tall not counting the handles and the base is 10 cm / 4 in diameter i also knitted a bigger version which is 23 cm / 9 tall with a 15 cm / 6 base the smaller bag uses about 50g of yarn and the big one 90g the knitting in the round was done on one long circular needle using the magic loop method you will need a 3 25 mm needle for the base and a 6 5 mm one for the body of the bag us sizes 3½ and 10½ a pair of straight 6 5 mm needles is useful for knitting the handles 1 one more note before starting on the pattern instructions - the stitch pattern used for these bags works well with variegated yarns and i have tried it with three different yarns each with a different length colour repeat see which one you prefer small knot bag for this bag i used stylecraft merry go round 294 m / 100g shade 3142 rainbow the colours change about every 2 5 m or 3 yds the base this is worked in stocking stitch on a 3 25 mm needle using the long tail method cast on eight stitches round 1 kf&b in every st 16 sts round 2 kf&b k1 x 8 24 sts round 3 and all odd numbered rounds knit round 4 kf&b k2 x 8 32 sts round 6 kf&b k3 x 8 40 sts round 8 kf&b k4 x 8 48 sts round 10 kf&b k5 x 8 56 sts round 12 kf&b k6 x 8 64 sts round 14 kf&b k7 x 8 72 sts round 16 kf&b k8 x 8 80 sts you need to add one stitch on the next round so that you have an odd number of stitches so knit the round increasing with a m1 anywhere on the first half of the stitches giving you 81 stitches all together the finished base should measure roughly 10 cm / 4 across as you can see i used a
